TopicTitle: Print money with XeEV-01 Xenon Extraction Unit?

Articles.Content:
This is my industrial-scale Money Print-*ahem*.. Xenon Extraction Machine:

With panels deployed:

So here's the thing. This machine has 48 of those XeEV-01 Xenon extraction units. Leave it sitting out in the sun for less than a day and you get 56000 units of Xenon Gas, which nets you well over 200000 in Kerbal currency when recovered, essentially rendering Career Mode into Science Mode.

I know the game balance isn't perfect yet, and maybe this is one of those things, but perhaps this could be tweaked a bit so it can't be used to make free money? Perhaps slowing down the rate of xenon production to the order of weeks or months for such quantities of gas, or increasing the power requirements for the Extraction Units. Or alternatively, if the game allows for this, put the gas produced by these units into some sort of fuel supply at the Space Center that can't be recovered for its cash value.

I think this really undermines much of the challenge of Career Mode (e.g. trying to put a modular space station in orbit on borrowed money and not bankrupting your space program). I don't object to the possibility of having your space program pay off economically at some point down the line, but I would rather this become possible after your space program becomes much more mature, after a long and costly pioneering era. (I haven't even reached Duna yet in this game). What do folks think? Anybody else notice this?

Congratulations, you discovered the big issue with all resource mods ever! This works in KSP because:

1.) the equipment is excessively cheap compared to the cost of resources - try adding three to four zeroes to the cost of your xenon producers

2.) you have 100% recovery and parts last forever with no maintenance required - try doing this off of the runway to simulate expenses for maintaining the equipment

3.) you don't have to pay wages to Kerbals, which gobbles up the largest part of revenue for RL resource mining companies

4.) you don't have to pay 20%-40% taxes on your profits

5.) you can timewarp, which effectively removes the factor of time investment with a slow process

A real xenon producing company would probably keep about 5,000 out of those 200,000 funds of income per day, and couldn't timewarp.

As for KSP and resource mods: set yourself a rule to not mine on Kerbin. You're a space program, not a for-profit mining company! Yes, it is an exploit, but you can choose not to exploit, you know

I thought this was a new stock part because the manufacturer (Ionic Symphonic Protonic Electronics) is the same as the stock xenon tank and engine and communications antennas. Or does the manufacturer not matter?

The manufacturer is just a simple text entry in the part configuration file. The modder can write literally anything in there, including "YOUR MOM!" or the cryptic number series from the TV show Lost. In most cases, modders either make up a new company or use those that are already known to exist, because hey, why not? It's just another product they put out!
